Lack enough support: The claim that no vegetarian is affected by coronavirus is not supported by any evidence or official statement from the World Health Organization (WHO).
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the virus requires animal protein in the body to survive, which is not based on scientific evidence or official statements from the WHO.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that there have been cases of vegetarians contracting the coronavirus, as confirmed by the WHO representative and various media reports.
Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the impact of vegetarianism on the risk of coronavirus infection, stating that as long as people eat meat, there will be a risk of infection.
Understate: There is no evidence of any bias of understating in the provided claim.
Falters at times: There is no evidence of any bias of faltering at times in the provided claim.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim fails to consider alternative explanations for the origin and transmission of the coronavirus, focusing solely on the consumption of animal protein.
